oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Uncle Bob on his horse Bob
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Uncle Bob on his horse Bob at Belle Meade Plantation.

As a young enslaved boy Robert "Bob" Green was brought to Belle Meade by William Giles Harding. He grew up working with the horses and became an expert on Thoroughbreds. He continued to live at Belle Meade after the Civil War, and worked as the head groom. When President Grover Cleveland visited in 1887, Bob gave President Cleveland a tour of the stables and horses.
